function_call.name: eval_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":["Increased risk of infectious diseases","Potential for increased covid-19 spread","Uncertainty about the impact of built environment on covid-19 transmission","Variations in associations of variables with covid-19 fatality rate","Spread of contagious diseases","Inaccurate results and inferences due to unobserved heterogeneity","Failure to consider smaller areas immediately around where people live and are exposed may limit the accuracy of the findings","Spread of contagious virus in construction sites","Misinformation and conspiracy theories about the pandemic","Underemphasis of the impacts of climate change on public health in public debates","Indoor air pollutants causing annual loss of disability-adjusted life years dalys and economic losses","Inadequate ventilation and air quality monitoring","Inadequate synchronisation between objective and subjective ieq data","Inadequate software design for data presentation and human-computer interaction","Continuous monitoring of indoor thermal performance throughout the year may increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases within the building","Inadequate ventilation in the hospital building may lead to high co2 concentrations, increasing the risk of disease transmission","Correlations between subjective and objective ieq data","Lack of scientific and simplified deployment scheme for ibem","The spread of covid-19 due to physical interaction and lack of lockdown measures","High energy consumption by public lighting and other systems","Potential impact of social distancing measures on service energy consumption","Potential spread of covid-19 due to unusual occupation of social assistance buildings and community centers during the pandemic","The study involves analyzing energy consumption in buildings, which could be a potential indicator of building occupancy and human activity, both of which contribute to the spread of contagious diseases"]}
